##### FILE: envoy2_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/envoy:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: envoy
  name: envoy
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: envoy
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: envoy
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: envoyproxy/envoy:v1.31-latest
        name: envoy
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8080
          name: grpc
        - containerPort: 9901
          name: admin
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /ready
            port: 9901
          initialDelaySeconds: 3
          periodSeconds: 3
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/envoy/envoy.yaml
          name: envoy-config
          subPath: envoy.yaml
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          items:
          - key: envoy-config.yaml
            path: envoy.yaml
          name: envoy-config
        name: envoy-config

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
skipped mutate policy add-safe-to-evict -> resource default/Deployment/envoy

1 - validate-podcontroller-namespace validation error: Using 'default' namespace is not allowed for pod controllers. rule validate-podcontroller-namespace failed at path /metadata/namespace/

policy drop-all-capabilities -> resource default/Deployment/envoy failed:
1 - autogen-require-drop-all validation failure: Containers must drop `ALL` capabilities.

policy drop-cap-net-raw -> resource default/Deployment/envoy failed:
1 - autogen-require-drop-cap-net-raw validation failure: Containers must drop the `CAP_NET_RAW` capability.

1 - autogen-check-for-labels validation error: The label `app.kubernetes.io/name` is required. rule autogen-check-for-labels failed at path /spec/template/metadata/labels/app.kubernetes.io/name/

1 - autogen-validate-resources validation error: CPU and memory resource requests and memory limits are required for containers. rule autogen-validate-resources failed at path /spec/template/spec/containers/0/resources/

##### FILE: envoy-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/envoy-deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: envoy-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: test-pod
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: test-pod
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - -c
        - /etc/envoy/envoy.yaml
        - --log-level
        - debug
        - --service-node
        - node1
        - --service-cluster
        - cluster1
        command:
        - /usr/local/bin/envoy
        image: envoyproxy/envoy:v1.26.5
        name: envoy
        ports:
        - containerPort: 10000
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /etc/envoy
          name: envoy-config-volume
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: envoy-config
        name: envoy-config-volume

##### FILE: ephemeral_storage_limit.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/ephemeral-storage-limit:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: ephemeral-storage-limit
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: ephemeral-storage-limit
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: ephemeral-storage-limit
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - |
          i=0; while true; do
            echo "iteration $i";
            dd if=/dev/zero of=/file$i bs=10M count=1024;
            i=$((i+1));
          done;
        command:
        - /bin/sh
        - -c
        image: busybox
        name: fill-disk-container
        resources:
          limits:
            ephemeral-storage: 1Gi
          requests:
            ephemeral-storage: 500Mi
      nodeSelector:
        env: test

---

##### FILE: ephemeral-volume.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/yolo:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: yolo
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - command:
    - sleep
    - "1000000"
    image: busybox:1.28
    name: test-container
    resources:
      limits:
        cpu: 500m
        memory: 128Mi
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /definition
      name: my-ephemeral-volume
  volumes:
  - csi:
      driver: csi-driver.mattslater.io
      volumeAttributes:
        csi-driver.mattslater.io/data: |
          you only live once
        csi-driver.mattslater.io/filename: yolo.txt
    name: my-ephemeral-volume

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/lol:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: lol
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - command:
    - sleep
    - "1000000"
    image: busybox:1.28
    name: test-container
    resources:
      limits:
        cpu: 500m
        memory: 128Mi
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /definition
      name: my-ephemeral-volume
  volumes:
  - csi:
      driver: csi-driver.mattslater.io
      volumeAttributes:
        csi-driver.mattslater.io/data: |
          laugh out loud
        csi-driver.mattslater.io/filename: lol.txt
    name: my-ephemeral-volume

---

##### FILE: ephemeralvolume_pod.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Pod/ephemeralvolume-pod:
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  labels:
    pod: timeserver-pod
  name: ephemeralvolume-pod
  namespace: default
spec:
  containers:
  - image: docker.io/wdenniss/timeserver:1
    name: timeserver-container
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /scratch
      name: scratch-volume
  volumes:
  - ephemeral:
      volumeClaimTemplate:
        metadata:
          labels:
            type: scratch-volume
        spec:
          accessModes:
          - ReadWriteOnce
          resources:
            requests:
              storage: 1Ti
          storageClassName: ephemeral
    name: scratch-volume

---

##### FILE: episode.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/episode1-deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: episode1
  name: episode1-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode1
  strategy:
    type: RollingUpdate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode1
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: USER_NAME
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: mongo-user
              name: mongo-secret
        - name: USR_PWD
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: mongo-password
              name: mongo-secret
        - name: MONGO_URL
          valueFrom:
            configMapKeyRef:
              key: mongo-url
              name: mongo-config
        image: masoodghauri/ep1-backend:latest
        name: ep1-backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8001

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/episode1-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode1-backend
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode1-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode1-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: MONGO_URI
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_URI
              name: mongodb-secret
        image: fatimaqurban/episode1_backend
        name: episode1-backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: mongodb-data
      volumes:
      - name: mongodb-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: db-claim-episode-01

---

        name: episode1-backend

            memory: 512Mi

            memory: 256Mi

##### FILE: episode1-backend-deployment1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/episode1-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode1-backend
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode1-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode1-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: MONGO_DB_SECRET
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_DB_SECRET
              name: mongodb-secret-episode1
        image: aghaali1/episode1-backend-image:latest
        name: backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: mongodb-data
      volumes:
      - name: mongodb-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: mongodb-pvc

##### FILE: episode1-frontend-deployment.yaml #####

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to development/Deployment/episode1-frontend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode1-frontend
  namespace: development
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode1-frontend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode1-frontend
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: notabd/episode1-frontend:latest
        name: episode1-frontend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 512Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 256Mi

##### FILE: episode2-backend-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to development/Deployment/episode2-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode2-backend
  namespace: development
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode2-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode2-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NODE_ENV
          value: production
        image: notabd/episode2-backend:latest
        name: episode2-backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 512Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 256Mi

##### FILE: episode2-backend-deployment1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/episode2-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: episode2-backend
  name: episode2-backend
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode2-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode2-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: MONGO_DB_SECRET
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_DB_SECRET
              name: mongodb-secret-episode2
        image: aghaali1/episode2-backend-image:latest
        name: backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3001
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: mongodb-data
      volumes:
      - name: mongodb-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: mongodb-pvc

---

kind: Deployment

    matchLabels:
      app: episode2-frontend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode2-frontend

      containers:
      - image: notabd/episode2-frontend:latest
        name: episode2-frontend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 512Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 256Mi

apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode3-backend
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode3-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode3-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: <your-dockerhub-username>/episode3-backend:<tag>
        name: backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3000

##### FILE: episode3-backend-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to development/Deployment/episode3-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode3-backend
  namespace: development
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode3-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode3-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NODE_ENV
          value: production
        image: notabd/episode3-backend:latest
        name: episode3-backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 512Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 256Mi

---

##### FILE: episode3-backend-deployment1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/episode3-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: episode3-backend
  name: episode3-backend
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode3-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode3-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: MONGO_DB_SECRET
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_DB_SECRET
              name: mongodb-secret-episode3
        image: aghaali1/episode3-backend-image:latest
        name: backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3002
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: mongodb-data
      volumes:
      - name: mongodb-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: mongodb-pvc

---

##### FILE: episode4_backend_deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/episode4-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode4-backend
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode4-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode4-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: MONGO_URI
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_URI
              name: mongodb-secret
        image: fatimaqurban/episode4_backend
        name: episode4-backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3003
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: mongodb-data
      volumes:
      - name: mongodb-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: db-claim-episode-04

---

        name: episode4-backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 8000
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 512Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 256Mi

  name: episode4-frontend
  namespace: development
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode4-frontend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode4-frontend
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: notabd/episode4-frontend:latest
        name: episode4-frontend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 80
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 512Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 250m
            memory: 256Mi

##### FILE: episode5_backend_deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/episode5-backend:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: episode5-backend
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: episode5-backend
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: episode5-backend
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: MONGO_URI
          valueFrom:
            secretKeyRef:
              key: MONGO_URI
              name: mongodb-secret
        image: fatimaqurban/episode5_backend
        name: episode5-backend
        ports:
        - containerPort: 3004
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data/db
          name: db-volume-episode-05
      volumes:
      - name: db-claim-episode-05
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: mongodb-pvc

---

    components:
      collector:
        enabled: true
        image:
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        limit: {}
        request: {}
      remover:
        image:
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        limit: {}
        request: {}
      scanner:
        config: ""
        enabled: true
        image:
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        limit: {}
        request: {}
    health: {}
    kind: EraserConfig
    leaderElection: {}
    manager:
      imageJob:
        cleanup: {}
        successRatio: 1
      logLevel: info
      nodeFilter:
        selectors:
        - eraser.sh/cleanup.filter
        - kubernetes.io/os=windows
        type: exclude
      otlpEndpoint: ""
      priorityClassName: ""
      profile: {}
      pullSecrets: []
      runtime:
        address: unix:///run/containerd/containerd.sock
        name: containerd
      scheduling: {}
    metrics: {}
    webhook: {}
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: eraser-manager-config
  namespace: default

##### FILE: eraser_templates_eraser-controller-manager-deployment_10.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/eraser-controller-manager:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/instance: my-release
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm
    app.kubernetes.io/name: eraser
    control-plane: controller-manager
    helm.sh/chart: eraser
  name: eraser-controller-manager
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app.kubernetes.io/instance: my-release
      app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm
      app.kubernetes.io/name: eraser
      control-plane: controller-manager
      helm.sh/chart: eraser
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app.kubernetes.io/instance: my-release
        app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm
        app.kubernetes.io/name: eraser
        control-plane: controller-manager
        helm.sh/chart: eraser
    spec:
      affinity: {}
      containers:
      - args:
        - --config=/config/controller_manager_config.yaml
        command:
        - /manager
        env:
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: OTEL_SERVICE_NAME
          value: eraser-manager
        image: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/eraser-manager:v1.4.0-beta.0
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 20
        name: manager
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          periodSeconds: 10
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 30Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 20Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsGroup: 65532
          runAsNonRoot: true
          runAsUser: 65532
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /config
          name: eraser-manager-config
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      priorityClassName: ""
      serviceAccountName: eraser-controller-manager
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      tolerations: []
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: eraser-manager-config
        name: eraser-manager-config

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.

policy add-networkpolicy-dns applied to default/Namespace/eraser-system:
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: NetworkPolicy
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: kyverno
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-name: add-networkpolicy-dns
    generate.kyverno.io/policy-namespace: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: add-netpol-dns
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-group: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-kind: Namespace
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-namespace: default
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-uid: ""
    generate.kyverno.io/trigger-version: v1
  name: allow-dns
  namespace: eraser-system
spec:
  egress:
  - ports:
    - port: 53
      protocol: UDP
    to:
    - namespaceSelector:
        matchLabels:
          name: kube-system
  podSelector:
    matchLabels: {}
  policyTypes:
  - Egress

---

    generate.kyverno.io/rule-name: generate-limitrange

##### FILE: eraser1_10.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to eraser-system/Deployment/eraser-controller-manager:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    control-plane: controller-manager
  name: eraser-controller-manager
  namespace: eraser-system
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      control-plane: controller-manager
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        control-plane: controller-manager
    spec:
      containers:
      - args:
        - --config=/config/controller_manager_config.yaml
        command:
        - /manager
        env:
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: OTEL_SERVICE_NAME
          value: eraser-manager
        image: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/eraser-manager:v1.4.0-beta.0
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 20
        name: manager
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          periodSeconds: 10
        resources:
          limits:
            memory: 30Mi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 20Mi
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsGroup: 65532
          runAsNonRoot: true
          runAsUser: 65532
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /config
          name: manager-config
      nodeSelector:
        kubernetes.io/os: linux
      serviceAccountName: eraser-controller-manager
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: eraser-manager-config
        name: manager-config

---


Mutation:

1 - autogen-check-for-labels validation error: The label `app.kubernetes.io/name` is required. rule autogen-check-for-labels failed at path /spec/template/metadata/labels/app.kubernetes.io/name/

##### FILE: eraser1_9.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to eraser-system/ConfigMap/eraser-manager-config:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  controller_manager_config.yaml: |
    apiVersion: eraser.sh/v1alpha3
    kind: EraserConfig
    manager:
      runtime:
        name: containerd
        address: unix:///run/containerd/containerd.sock
      otlpEndpoint: ""
      logLevel: info
      scheduling:
        repeatInterval: 24h
        beginImmediately: true
      profile:
        enabled: false
        port: 6060
      imageJob:
        successRatio: 1.0
        cleanup:
          delayOnSuccess: 0s
          delayOnFailure: 24h
      pullSecrets: [] # image pull secrets for collector/scanner/eraser
      priorityClassName: "" # priority class name for collector/scanner/eraser
      nodeFilter:
        type: exclude # must be either exclude|include
        selectors:
          - eraser.sh/cleanup.filter
          - kubernetes.io/os=windows
    components:
      collector:
        enabled: true
        image:
          repo: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/collector
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        request:
          mem: 25Mi
          cpu: 7m
        limit:
          mem: 500Mi
          # https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#how-pods-with-resource-limits-are-run
          cpu: 0
      scanner:
        enabled: true
        image:
          repo: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/eraser-trivy-scanner # supply custom image for custom scanner
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        request:
          mem: 500Mi
          cpu: 1000m
        limit:
          mem: 2Gi
          # https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#how-pods-with-resource-limits-are-run
          cpu: 0
        # The config needs to be passed through to the scanner as yaml, as a
        # single string. Because we allow custom scanner images, the scanner is
        # responsible for defining a schema, parsing, and validating.
        config: |
          # this is the schema for the provided 'trivy-scanner'. custom scanners
          # will define their own configuration.
          cacheDir: /var/lib/trivy
          dbRepo: ghcr.io/aquasecurity/trivy-db
          deleteFailedImages: true
          deleteEOLImages: true
          vulnerabilities:
            ignoreUnfixed: true
            types:
              - os
              - library
            securityChecks:
              - vuln
            severities:
              - CRITICAL
              - HIGH
              - MEDIUM
              - LOW
            ignoredStatuses:
          timeout:
            total: 23h
            perImage: 1h
      remover:
        image:
          repo: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/remover
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        request:
          mem: 25Mi
          # https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#how-pods-with-resource-limits-are-run
          cpu: 0
        limit:
          mem: 30Mi
          cpu: 0
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: eraser-manager-config
  namespace: eraser-system

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
pass: 0, fail: 0, warn: 0, error: 0, skip: 0

            port: 8081

##### FILE: eraser2_9.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to eraser-system/ConfigMap/eraser-manager-config:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  controller_manager_config.yaml: |
    apiVersion: eraser.sh/v1alpha3
    kind: EraserConfig
    manager:
      runtime:
        name: containerd
        address: unix:///run/containerd/containerd.sock
      otlpEndpoint: ""
      logLevel: info
      scheduling:
        repeatInterval: 24h
        beginImmediately: true
      profile:
        enabled: false
        port: 6060
      imageJob:
        successRatio: 1.0
        cleanup:
          delayOnSuccess: 0s
          delayOnFailure: 24h
      pullSecrets: [] # image pull secrets for collector/scanner/eraser
      priorityClassName: "" # priority class name for collector/scanner/eraser
      additionalPodLabels: {}
      nodeFilter:
        type: exclude # must be either exclude|include
        selectors:
          - eraser.sh/cleanup.filter
          - kubernetes.io/os=windows
    components:
      collector:
        enabled: true
        image:
          repo: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/collector
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        request:
          mem: 25Mi
          cpu: 7m
        limit:
          mem: 500Mi
          # https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#how-pods-with-resource-limits-are-run
          cpu: 0
      scanner:
        enabled: true
        image:
          repo: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/eraser-trivy-scanner # supply custom image for custom scanner
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        request:
          mem: 500Mi
          cpu: 1000m
        limit:
          mem: 2Gi
          # https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#how-pods-with-resource-limits-are-run
          cpu: 0
        # The config needs to be passed through to the scanner as yaml, as a
        # single string. Because we allow custom scanner images, the scanner is
        # responsible for defining a schema, parsing, and validating.
        config: |
          # this is the schema for the provided 'trivy-scanner'. custom scanners
          # will define their own configuration.
          cacheDir: /var/lib/trivy
          dbRepo: ghcr.io/aquasecurity/trivy-db
          deleteFailedImages: true
          deleteEOLImages: true
          vulnerabilities:
            ignoreUnfixed: true
            types:
              - os
              - library
            securityChecks:
              - vuln
            severities:
              - CRITICAL
              - HIGH
              - MEDIUM
              - LOW
            ignoredStatuses:
          timeout:
            total: 23h
            perImage: 1h
      remover:
        image:
          repo: ghcr.io/eraser-dev/remover
          tag: v1.4.0-beta.0
        request:
          mem: 25Mi
          # https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/#how-pods-with-resource-limits-are-run
          cpu: 0
        limit:
          mem: 30Mi
          cpu: 0
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: eraser-manager-config
  namespace: eraser-system

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
pass: 0, fail: 0, warn: 0, error: 0, skip: 0 

##### FILE: eraser-controller-manager-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to dynamic_parameters/Deployment/eraser-controller-manager:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app.kubernetes.io/instance: dynamic_parameters
    app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: dynamic_parameters
    app.kubernetes.io/name: dynamic_parameters
    control-plane: controller-manager
    helm.sh/chart: dynamic_parameters
  name: eraser-controller-manager
  namespace: dynamic_parameters
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app.kubernetes.io/instance: dynamic_parameters
      app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: dynamic_parameters
      app.kubernetes.io/name: dynamic_parameters
      control-plane: controller-manager
      helm.sh/chart: dynamic_parameters
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app.kubernetes.io/instance: dynamic_parameters
        app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: dynamic_parameters
        app.kubernetes.io/name: dynamic_parameters
        control-plane: controller-manager
        helm.sh/chart: dynamic_parameters
    spec:
      affinity: null
      containers:
      - args:
        - --config=/config/controller_manager_config.yaml
        command:
        - /manager
        env:
        - name: POD_NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              apiVersion: v1
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: OTEL_SERVICE_NAME
          value: eraser-manager
        image: dynamic_parameters:dynamic_parameters
        imagePullPolicy: dynamic_parameters
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /healthz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 15
          periodSeconds: 20
        name: manager
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /readyz
            port: 8081
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          periodSeconds: 10
        resources: null
        securityContext:
          allowPrivilegeEscalation: false
          capabilities:
            drop:
            - ALL
          readOnlyRootFilesystem: true
          runAsGroup: 65532
          runAsNonRoot: true
          runAsUser: 65532
          seccompProfile:
            type: RuntimeDefault
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /config
          name: eraser-manager-config
      imagePullSecrets:
      - name: dynamic_parameters
      nodeSelector: null
      priorityClassName: dynamic_parameters
      serviceAccountName: eraser-controller-manager
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 10
      tolerations: null
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: eraser-manager-config
        name: eraser-manager-config

---

##### FILE: eraser-pod-cleaner.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/CronJob/eraser-k3s-cleaner:
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: CronJob
metadata:
  name: eraser-k3s-cleaner
  namespace: default
spec:
  jobTemplate:
    spec:
      template:
        spec:
          containers:
          - command:
            - /bin/sh
            - -c
            - |
              # Find and delete pods in 'Succeeded' state with 'eraser-k3s' in their name in the kube-system namespace
              kubectl get pods -n kube-system --field-selector=status.phase=Succeeded -o jsonpath='{.items[*].metadata.name}' | \
              tr ' ' '\n' | grep 'eraser-k3s' | while read pod; do
                kubectl delete pod $pod -n kube-system;
              done
            image: bitnami/kubectl:latest
            name: pod-cleaner
          restartPolicy: OnFailure
          serviceAccountName: eraser-k3s-cleaner-sa
  schedule: 0 0 * * *
  timeZone: ${TIMEZONE}

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.

kind: Ingress

    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/rewrite-target: /$2
    nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/use-regex: "true"
  name: erp-ingress
  namespace: erp
spec:
  rules:
  - host: ae73adf0061dc4d49ab515bf812150d9-1090975536.eu-central-1.elb.amazonaws.com
    http:
      paths:
      - backend:
          service:
            name: erp-server-service
            port:
              number: 6000
        path: /erp/api(/|$)(.*)
        pathType: ImplementationSpecific
      - backend:
          service:
            name: erp-client-service
            port:
              number: 80
        path: /erp(/|$)(.*)
        pathType: ImplementationSpecific

##### FILE: es01-deployment.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/es01:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    io.kompose.service: es01
  name: es01
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      io.kompose.service: es01
  strategy:
    type: Recreate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        io.kompose.network/elastic: "true"
        io.kompose.service: es01
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: ELASTIC_PASSWORD
        - name: bootstrap.memory_lock
          value: "true"
        - name: cluster.name
        - name: discovery.type
          value: single-node
        - name: node.name
          value: es01
        - name: xpack.license.self_generated.type
        - name: xpack.security.enabled
          value: "true"
        - name: xpack.security.http.ssl.certificate
          value: certs/es01/es01.crt
        - name: xpack.security.http.ssl.certificate_authorities
          value: certs/ca/ca.crt
        - name: xpack.security.http.ssl.enabled
          value: "true"
        - name: xpack.security.http.ssl.key
          value: certs/es01/es01.key
        - name: xpack.security.transport.ssl.certificate
          value: certs/es01/es01.crt
        - name: xpack.security.transport.ssl.certificate_authorities
          value: certs/ca/ca.crt
        - name: xpack.security.transport.ssl.enabled
          value: "true"
        - name: xpack.security.transport.ssl.key
          value: certs/es01/es01.key
        - name: xpack.security.transport.ssl.verification_mode
          value: certificate
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:8.13.2
        livenessProbe:
          exec:
            command:
            - curl -s --cacert config/certs/ca/ca.crt https://localhost:9200 | grep
              -q 'missing authentication credentials'
          failureThreshold: 120
          periodSeconds: 10
          timeoutSeconds: 10
        name: es01
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          protocol: TCP
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/config/certs
          name: certs
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: esdata01
      restartPolicy: Always
      volumes:
      - name: certs
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: certs
      - name: esdata01
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: esdata01

---

##### FILE: es10.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/StatefulSet/es-cluster:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: es-cluster
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: cluster.name
          value: k8s-logs
        - name: node.name
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: discovery.seed_hosts
          value: es-cluster-0.elasticsearch,es-cluster-1.elasticsearch,es-cluster-2.elasticsearch
        - name: cluster.initial_master_nodes
          value: es-cluster-0,es-cluster-1,es-cluster-2
        - name: ES_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms512m -Xmx512m
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.14.0
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: rest
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: inter-node
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - chown -R 1000:1000 /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
        image: busybox
        name: fix-permissions
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        name: increase-vm-max-map
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - ulimit -n 65536
        image: busybox
        name: increase-fd-ulimit
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 3Gi

---

    appgw.ingress.kubernetes.io/backend-protocol: HTTP
    appgw.ingress.kubernetes.io/health-probe-hostname: elasticsearch-master
    appgw.ingress.kubernetes.io/health-probe-unhealthy-threshold: "2"
    appgw.ingress.kubernetes.io/request-timeout: "60"
    appgw.ingress.kubernetes.io/ssl-redirect: "true"
    cert-manager.io/cluster-issuer: letsencrypt-issuer
    kubernetes.io/ingress.class: azure/application-gateway
  name: es
  namespace: elk

  rules:
  - host: elastic.azure.rentrahisi.co.ke
    http:
      paths:
      - backend:
          service:
            name: elasticsearch-master
            port:
              number: 9200
        path: /
        pathType: Prefix
  tls:
  - hosts:
    - elastic.azure.rentrahisi.co.ke

##### FILE: es7_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/StatefulSet/elasticsearch:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: elasticsearch
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      component: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        component: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: discovery.type
          value: single-node
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.12.0
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 4Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 500m
            memory: 4Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/config/elasticsearch.yml
          name: elasticsearch-config
          subPath: elasticsearch.yml
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: elasticsearch-data
      restartPolicy: Always
      securityContext:
        fsGroup: 1000
      volumes:
      - configMap:
          name: elasticsearch-config
        name: elasticsearch-config
      - name: elasticsearch-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: elasticsearch-pvc

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/es-deployment:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: es
  name: es-deployment
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: es
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: es
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:8.13.2
        name: es
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/config/certs
          name: certs
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: es-data
      volumes:
      - name: certs
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: certs
      - name: es-data
        persistentVolumeClaim:
          claimName: es-data

---

##### FILE: es-client-rc.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ReplicationController/es-client:
apiVersion: v1
kind: ReplicationController
metadata:
  labels:
    component: elasticsearch
    role: client
  name: es-client
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        component: elasticsearch
        role: client
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: KUBERNETES_CA_CERTIFICATE_FILE
          value: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: CLUSTER_NAME
          value: myesdb
        - name: NODE_MASTER
          value: "false"
        - name: NODE_DATA
          value: "false"
        - name: HTTP_ENABLE
          value: "true"
        image: quay.io/pires/docker-elasticsearch-kubernetes:1.7.1-4
        name: es-client
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        securityContext:
          capabilities:
            add:
            - IPC_LOCK
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: storage
      serviceAccount: elasticsearch
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: storage

---

##### FILE: es-cluster1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-logging/StatefulSet/es-cluster:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: es-cluster
  namespace: kube-logging
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: cluster.name
          value: k8s-logs
        - name: node.name
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: discovery.seed_hosts
          value: es-cluster-0.elasticsearch,es-cluster-1.elasticsearch,es-cluster-2.elasticsearch
        - name: cluster.initial_master_nodes
          value: es-cluster-0,es-cluster-1,es-cluster-2
        - name: ES_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms512m -Xmx512m
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.2.0
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: rest
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: inter-node
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - chown -R 1000:1000 /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
        image: busybox
        name: fix-permissions
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        name: increase-vm-max-map
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - ulimit -n 65536
        image: busybox
        name: increase-fd-ulimit
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 10Gi
      storageClassName: manual

---

apiVersion: v1
kind: ReplicationController
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v1
  name: elasticsearch-logging-v1
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    version: v1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v1
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: harbor-001.jimmysong.io/library/elasticsearch:v2.4.1-2
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: es-persistent-storage
      serviceAccountName: efk
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: es-persistent-storage

##### FILE: es-data-rc1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ReplicationController/es-data:
apiVersion: v1
kind: ReplicationController
metadata:
  labels:
    component: elasticsearch
    role: data
  name: es-data
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        component: elasticsearch
        role: data
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: KUBERNETES_CA_CERTIFICATE_FILE
          value: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: CLUSTER_NAME
          value: myesdb
        - name: NODE_MASTER
          value: "false"
        - name: HTTP_ENABLE
          value: "false"
        image: quay.io/pires/docker-elasticsearch-kubernetes:1.7.1-4
        name: es-data
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        securityContext:
          capabilities:
            add:
            - IPC_LOCK
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: storage
      serviceAccount: elasticsearch
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: storage

---

##### FILE: es-dep.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-logging/StatefulSet/es-cluster:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: es-cluster
  namespace: kube-logging
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: cluster.name
          value: gitops
        - name: node.name
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: discovery.seed_hosts
          value: es-cluster-0.elasticsearch,es-cluster-1.elasticsearch,es-cluster-2.elasticsearch
        - name: cluster.initial_master_nodes
          value: es-cluster-0,es-cluster-1,es-cluster-2
        - name: ES_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms1g -Xmx1g
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.5.2
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: rest
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: inter-node
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - chown -R 1000:1000 /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
        image: busybox
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: fix-permissions
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        name: increase-vm-max-map
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - ulimit -n 65536
        image: busybox
        name: increase-fd-ulimit
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 5Gi
      storageClassName: standard

---

##### FILE: es-deployment3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/Deployment/es-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: es-logging
  name: es-logging
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: es-logging
  strategy:
    rollingUpdate:
      maxSurge: 25%!
(MISSING)      maxUnavailable: 25%!
(MISSING)    type: RollingUpdate
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        app: es-logging
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: discovery.type
          value: single-node
        image: elasticsearch:7.8.0
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        livenessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /_cluster/health
            port: http
          initialDelaySeconds: 40
          periodSeconds: 10
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          httpGet:
            path: /_cluster/health
            port: http
          initialDelaySeconds: 30
          periodSeconds: 10
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: elasticsearch-logging

---

##### FILE: es-master-rc.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ReplicationController/es-master:
apiVersion: v1
kind: ReplicationController
metadata:
  labels:
    component: elasticsearch
    role: master
  name: es-master
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        component: elasticsearch
        role: master
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: KUBERNETES_CA_CERTIFICATE_FILE
          value: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: CLUSTER_NAME
          value: myesdb
        - name: NODE_MASTER
          value: "true"
        - name: NODE_DATA
          value: "false"
        - name: HTTP_ENABLE
          value: "false"
        image: quay.io/pires/docker-elasticsearch-kubernetes:1.7.1-4
        name: es-master
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        securityContext:
          capabilities:
            add:
            - IPC_LOCK
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: storage
      serviceAccount: elasticsearch
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: storage

---

  namespace: kube-system

  kind: ClusterRole
  name: gce:podsecuritypolicy:privileged

##### FILE: es-rc.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ReplicationController/es:
apiVersion: v1
kind: ReplicationController
metadata:
  labels:
    component: elasticsearch
  name: es
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        component: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: KUBERNETES_CA_CERTIFICATE_FILE
          value: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: CLUSTER_NAME
          value: myesdb
        - name: DISCOVERY_SERVICE
          value: elasticsearch
        - name: NODE_MASTER
          value: "true"
        - name: NODE_DATA
          value: "true"
        - name: HTTP_ENABLE
          value: "true"
        image: quay.io/pires/docker-elasticsearch-kubernetes:5.6.2
        name: es
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        securityContext:
          capabilities:
            add:
            - IPC_LOCK
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: storage
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        name: init-sysctl
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccount: elasticsearch
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: storage

---

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    version: v7.2.0
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v7.2.0
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        version: v7.2.0
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: quay.io/fluentd_elasticsearch/elasticsearch:v7.2.0
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: elasticsearch-logging

##### FILE: es-statefulset1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: elasticsearch:6.8.4
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: elasticsearch-logging
  updateStrategy:
    type: RollingUpdate

---

##### FILE: es-statefulset2.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/StatefulSet/es-cluster:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: es-cluster
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: cluster.name
          value: k8s-logs
        - name: node.name
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: discovery.seed_hosts
          value: es-cluster-0.elasticsearch,es-cluster-1.elasticsearch,es-cluster-2.elasticsearch
        - name: cluster.initial_master_nodes
          value: es-cluster-0,es-cluster-1,es-cluster-2
        - name: ES_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms512m -Xmx512m
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.14.0
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: rest
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: inter-node
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - chown -R 1000:1000 /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
        image: busybox
        name: fix-permissions
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        name: increase-vm-max-map
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - ulimit -n 65536
        image: busybox
        name: increase-fd-ulimit
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 3Gi

---

##### FILE: es-statefulset4_3.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: Reconcile
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    version: v7.4.3
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v7.4.3
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        version: v7.4.3
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: MINIMUM_MASTER_NODES
          value: "1"
        image: quay.io/fluentd_elasticsearch/elasticsearch:v7.4.3
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        livenessProbe:
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          tcpSocket:
            port: transport
          timeoutSeconds: 10
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        readinessProbe:
          initialDelaySeconds: 5
          tcpSocket:
            port: transport
          timeoutSeconds: 10
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
            memory: 3Gi
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
            memory: 3Gi
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: elasticsearch-logging

---

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-system/StatefulSet/elasticsearch-logging:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  labels:
    addonmanager.kubernetes.io/mode: EnsureExists
    k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
    kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
    version: v5.6.4
  name: elasticsearch-logging
  namespace: kube-system
spec:
  replicas: 2
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
      version: v5.6.4
  serviceName: elasticsearch-logging
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        k8s-app: elasticsearch-logging
        kubernetes.io/cluster-service: "true"
        version: v5.6.4
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        image: k8s.gcr.io/elasticsearch:v5.6.4
        name: elasticsearch-logging
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: db
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: elasticsearch-logging
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - /sbin/sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: alpine:3.6
        name: elasticsearch-logging-init
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccountName: elasticsearch-logging
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: elasticsearch-logging

---

##### FILE: es-sts.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/StatefulSet/es-cluster:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: es-cluster
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: cluster.name
          value: k8s-logs
        - name: node.name
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.name
        - name: discovery.seed_hosts
          value: es-cluster-0.elasticsearch,es-cluster-1.elasticsearch,es-cluster-2.elasticsearch
        - name: cluster.initial_master_nodes
          value: es-cluster-0,es-cluster-1,es-cluster-2
        - name: ES_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms512m -Xmx512m
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.5.0
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: rest
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: inter-node
          protocol: TCP
        resources:
          limits:
            cpu: 1000m
          requests:
            cpu: 100m
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - chown -R 1000:1000 /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
        image: busybox
        name: fix-permissions
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        name: increase-vm-max-map
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - ulimit -n 65536
        image: busybox
        name: increase-fd-ulimit
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 3Gi

---


Mutation:

##### FILE: es-sts4.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/StatefulSet/es-cluster:
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: StatefulSet
metadata:
  name: es-cluster
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: elasticsearch
  serviceName: elasticsearch
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: cluster.name
          value: standalone-cluster
        - name: node.name
          value: standalone-node
        - name: discovery.seed_hosts
          value: elasticsearch
        - name: cluster.initial_master_nodes
          value: standalone-node
        - name: ES_JAVA_OPTS
          value: -Xms512m -Xmx512m
        image: docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch:7.2.0
        name: elasticsearch
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - chown -R 1000:1000 /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
        image: busybox
        name: fix-permissions
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /usr/share/elasticsearch/data
          name: data
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: busybox
        name: increase-vm-max-map
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      - command:
        - sh
        - -c
        - ulimit -n 65536
        image: busybox
        name: increase-fd-ulimit
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
  volumeClaimTemplates:
  - metadata:
      labels:
        app: elasticsearch
      name: data
    spec:
      accessModes:
      - ReadWriteOnce
      resources:
        requests:
          storage: 3Gi
      storageClassName: manual

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to default/ReplicationController/es:
apiVersion: v1
kind: ReplicationController
metadata:
  labels:
    component: elasticsearch
  name: es
  namespace: default
spec:
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      annotations:
        cluster-autoscaler.kubernetes.io/safe-to-evict: "true"
      labels:
        component: elasticsearch
    spec:
      containers:
      - env:
        - name: KUBERNETES_CA_CERTIFICATE_FILE
          value: /var/run/secrets/kubernetes.io/serviceaccount/ca.crt
        - name: NAMESPACE
          valueFrom:
            fieldRef:
              fieldPath: metadata.namespace
        - name: CLUSTER_NAME
          value: myesdb
        - name: DISCOVERY_SERVICE
          value: elasticsearch
        - name: NODE_MASTER
          value: "true"
        - name: NODE_DATA
          value: "true"
        - name: HTTP_ENABLE
          value: "true"
        image: quay.io/pires/docker-elasticsearch-kubernetes:5.6.2
        name: es
        ports:
        - containerPort: 9200
          name: http
          protocol: TCP
        - containerPort: 9300
          name: transport
          protocol: TCP
        securityContext:
          capabilities:
            add:
            - IPC_LOCK
        volumeMounts:
        - mountPath: /data
          name: storage
      initContainers:
      - command:
        - sysctl
        - -w
        - vm.max_map_count=262144
        image: docker.io/library/busybox:1.31.1
        imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent
        name: init-sysctl
        securityContext:
          privileged: true
      serviceAccount: elasticsearch
      volumes:
      - emptyDir: {}
        name: storage

---

##### FILE: etcd_backup_cj_1.yaml #####

Applying 61 policy rule(s) to 1 resource(s)...

policy add-safe-to-evict applied to kube-backup/ConfigMap/backup-etcd-code:
apiVersion: v1
data:
  backup.sh: |
    #!/bin/bash
    kubelet_status=`systemctl status kubelet | sed -n 3p`
    kubelet_status=($kubelet_status)
    kubelet=${kubelet_status[1]}
    if [ $kubelet != "active" ]; then
        echo "[Error] Kubelet is not active now, please start kubelet before recovering etcd."
        exit
    else
        echo "Please input the master hostname ips  to be recovered, and seperated them with a blank space(must 3 nodes in 3 lines)."
        echo
        echo "Example:"
        echo "   master-10-29-22-5 10.29.22.5"
        echo "   master-10-29-22-6 10.29.22.6"
        echo "   master-10-29-22-7 10.29.22.7"
        echo
        read memberhostname1 memberhostip1
        read memberhostname2 memberhostip2
        read memberhostname3 memberhostip3
    fi
    echo "Please input the etcd V3 db file you want to recover with full path, and make sure it exists on all the masters."
    echo
    echo "Example:"
    echo "  /tmp/etcd_backup/backup_v3_20240126161041.db"
    echo

    read db
    #cluster_member=($master_member)
    #hostips=$(hostname -I)
    #ip_array=($hostips)
    #hostip=${ip_array[0]}
    echo "Please input local ip address for etcd endpoint."
    echo
    echo "Example:"
    echo "  "$(hostname -I |awk '{print $1}')
    echo
    read hostip

    initial_cluster="--initial-cluster "
    num_in=0
    initial_cluster=${initial_cluster}${memberhostname1}=https://${memberhostip1}:2380,${memberhostname2}=https://${memberhostip2}:2380,${memberhostname3}=https://${memberhostip3}:2380

    mkdir -p /tmp/yaml_bak
    echo "Please make sure you press enter at the same time on all the masters, ready to stop all the API server instances?"
    read answer

    mv /etc/kubernetes/manifests/*.yaml /tmp/yaml_bak/
    echo "All the API server yaml files have been moved from /etc/kubernetes/manifests to /tmp/yaml_bak"

    timestamp=`date +"%!Y(MISSING)%!m(MISSING)%!d(MISSING)%!H(MISSING)%!M(MISSING)%!S(MISSING)"`
    mkdir /var/lib/etcdback
    mv /var/lib/etcd /var/lib/etcdback/etcd_backup_${timestamp}
    echo "Etcd data directory has been moved from /var/lib/etcd to /var/lib/etcdback/etcd_backup_${timestamp} as backup."
    endpoint="--endpoints=https://localhost:2379"
    cert="--cert=/etc/kubernetes/ssl/etcd/server.crt --key=/etc/kubernetes/ssl/etcd/server.key --cacert=/etc/kubernetes/ssl/etcd/ca.crt"
    param=${endpoint}" "${cert}
    ETCDCTL_API=3
    echo "Starting to recover etcd cluster..."
    sleep 30

    /tmp/etcd_backup/etcdutl snapshot restore $db --data-dir /var/lib/etcd --name=$(hostname) $initial_cluster --initial-advertise-peer-urls https://$hostip:2380
    echo "Please make sure you press enter at the same time on all the masters, ready to start etcd instances?"
    read answer

    mv /tmp/yaml_bak/etcd.yaml /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml
    echo "Etcd yaml file has been moved from /tmp/yaml_bak/etcd.yaml to /etc/kubernetes/manifests/etcd.yaml, waiting for etcd instances ready..."

    retry_cnt=0
    retry_total=30
    while :
    do
        if [ $retry_total -gt $retry_cnt ]; then
            etcd_container=`nerdctl ps |grep etcd |grep $(hostname) | grep -v pause | awk '{print $1}'`
            if [ -n "$etcd_container" ];then
                break
            else
                retry_cnt=$(($retry_cnt+1))
                sleep 30
            fi
        else
            echo "[Error] Start etcd instace failed."
            exit 1
        fi
    done
    echo "Please make sure you press enter at the same time on all the masters, ready to check etcd cluster health?"
    read answer
    cluster_health=`nerdctl exec -it -e ETCDCTL_API=3 $etcd_container -- etcdctl --cert=/etc/kubernetes/ssl/etcd/server.crt --key=/etc/kubernetes/ssl/etcd/server.key --cacert=/etc/kubernetes/ssl/etcd/ca.crt endpoint health --cluster |grep unhealthy`
    echo "Etcd cluster health status $cluster_health"
    health=${cluster_health: 0-8 :7}
    if [ "$cluster_health" != "" ]; then
        echo "[Error] Etcd cluster is unhealthy nowplease repair to healthy before backup."
        exit
    else
        /tmp/etcd_backup/etcdctl $param member list
    fi

    echo "Etcd cluster has been successfully recovered. Please make sure you press enter at the same time on all the masters, ready to recover all the API server instances?"
    read answer

    mv /tmp/yaml_bak/kube-apiserver.yaml /etc/kubernetes/manifests/
    sleep 5

    echo "Restarting kubelet..."
    systemctl restart kubelet
    sleep 5

    mv /tmp/yaml_bak/*.yaml /etc/kubernetes/manifests/
    echo "Etcd V3 data has been successfully recovered, now you can recover V2 data on any one master."
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: backup-etcd-code
  namespace: kube-backup

---


Mutation:
Mutation has been applied successfully.
pass: 0, fail: 0, warn: 0, error: 0, skip: 0

    component: dce-etcd-backup
  name: dce-etcd-backup
  namespace: kube-backup

    requests:
      storage: 50Gi
  storageClassName: ""
  volumeMode: Filesystem
